intro: Clinostigma bracteale, commonly known as the bracteate clinostigma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically ovate to lanceolate in shape, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Clinostigma bracteale is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
